required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Evaluating the Effectiveness and Safety of the PowerMe Midline Catheter in the Chinese Population
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-center, Open-label, Randomized, Controlled Non-inferiority Clinical Trial Evaluating the Effectiveness and Safety of the PowerMe Midline Catheter Versus Traditional PIV in the Chinese Population

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the effectiveness and the safety of the PowerMeTM Midline Catheter in the Chinese population.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, multi-center, open-label, randomized, controlled, non-inferiority clinical trial designed to evaluate the effectiveness and the safety of the PowerMeTM Midline Catheter compared to PIVC in the Chinese population in order to support the product's registration in China.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptance of the overall performance of the IV catheter system

secondary_outcome.measure: Success rate of the first insertion of the catheter
secondary_outcome.description: Successful first insertion means the IV catheter system can be successfully inserted into the blood vessel on the first insertion.
The retention time of the IV catheter system of each subject after successful insertion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of good performance of the pinch clamp
secondary_outcome.description: If the pinch clamp can close and open the tubing properly, performance of the pinch clamp can be evaluated as "good".
The catheter system is blocked, causing the system to fail to infuse the fluid after it is connected to the infusion set/syringe.
Unintentional premature removal of the catheter from the vessel.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University
